title: Exploring Corporate Tax Avoidance: Effects on Comprehensive Budget Income – a Practical Analysis
content: This paper addresses the pressing concern of corporate tax evasion recognized by several nations, employing insights from public choice theory and tax compliance theory. The research aims to evaluate the ramifications of corporate tax evasion on public revenue, public expenditures, tax rates, and the prevailing budget deficit. Methodologically, the study utilizes questionnaire data and employs structural equation modeling for analysis. The findings indicate that tax evasion is significantly influenced by multiple factors, encompassing tax income, public expenditures, tax rates, and the budget deficit. The article offers a comprehensive exploration of both theoretical frameworks and practical implications, contributing valuable insights to the ongoing discourse on corporate tax evasion and its multifaceted impact on fiscal dynamics.
